publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1670# Mr George Reid: National Tartan Day—That the Parliament notes the importance of National Tartan Day, held annually in the United States on 6 April, which celebrates the contribution of Scots and Scots-Americans to the creation and prosperity of America and welcomes the opportunities National Tartan Day offers as a vehicle for strengthening economic, social and cultural links between our two countries. Supported by: Patricia Ferguson*
S1M-1670# National Tartan Day (lodged on 14 February 2001) Mr Alex Salmond*, Michael Matheson*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*

S1M-1670# Mr George Reid: National Tartan Day—That the Parliament notes the importance of National Tartan Day, held annually in the United States on 6 April, which celebrates the contribution of Scots and Scots-Americans to the creation and prosperity of America and welcomes the opportunities National Tartan Day offers as a vehicle for strengthening economic, social and cultural links between our two countries. Supported by: Patricia Ferguson, Mr Alex Salmond, Michael Matheson, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Christine Grahame*
S1M-1670# National Tartan Day (lodged on 14 February 2001) Donald Gorrie*, Mr Keith Raffan*
S1M-1670# National Tartan Day (lodged on 14 February 2001) Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-1670# National Tartan Day (lodged on 14 February 2001) Ms Sandra White*, Fiona McLeod*, Robert Brown*
S1M-1670# National Tartan Day (lodged on 14 February 2001) Brian Adam*

S1M-1670# Mr George Reid: National Tartan Day—That the Parliament notes the importance of National Tartan Day, held annually in the United States on 6 April, which celebrates the contribution of Scots and Scots-Americans to the creation and prosperity of America and welcomes the opportunities National Tartan Day offers as a vehicle for strengthening economic, social and cultural links between our two countries. Supported by: Patricia Ferguson, Mr Alex Salmond, Michael Matheson, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Christine Grahame, Donald Gorrie, Mr Keith Raffan, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Ms Sandra White, Fiona McLeod, Robert Brown, Brian Adam, Karen Whitefield*
S1M-1670# National Tartan Day (lodged on 14 February 2001) Fergus Ewing*, Richard Lochhead*
S1M-1670# National Tartan Day (lodged on 14 February 2001) Fiona Hyslop*
S1M-1670# National Tartan Day (lodged on 14 February 2001) Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Tricia Marwick*, Andrew Wilson*, Mr Duncan Hamilton*
S1M-1670# National Tartan Day (lodged on 14 February 2001) Nora Radcliffe*

S1M-1670# Mr George Reid: National Tartan Day—That the Parliament notes the importance of National Tartan Day, held annually in the United States on 6 April, which celebrates the contribution of Scots and Scots-Americans to the creation and prosperity of America and welcomes the opportunities National Tartan Day offers as a vehicle for strengthening economic, social and cultural links between our two countries. Supported by: Patricia Ferguson, Mr Alex Salmond, Michael Matheson, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Christine Grahame, Donald Gorrie, Mr Keith Raffan, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Ms Sandra White, Fiona McLeod, Robert Brown, Brian Adam, Karen Whitefield, Fergus Ewing, Richard Lochhead, Fiona Hyslop, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Tricia Marwick, Andrew Wilson, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Nora Radcliffe
S1M-1670# National Tartan Day (lodged on 14 February 2001) Kay Ullrich*, Colin Campbell*
S1M-1670# National Tartan Day (lodged on 14 February 2001) Irene Oldfather*
